title: Aglapsvik
text: Aglapsvik is a small, isolated coastal village in <a href="Senja%20Municipality">Senja Municipality</a> in <a href="Troms">Troms</a> county in <a href="Northern%20Norway">Northern Norway</a>. It is located along the <a href="Malangen%20%28fjord%29">Malangen</a> <a href="fjord">fjord</a>, about north of the town of <a href="Finnsnes">Finnsnes</a>. The name of the village comes from the nearby mountain "Aglapen". The area is mostly hilly and forested and there is one small road (County Road 263) passing through. There are about 50 residents.
